about_the_game:
DESCRIPTION:
Segment In Space 1985 is a psychological horror with an exciting plot and the first game in the OSPIL series. You will find yourself in the place of a person who turned out to be at the wrong time and in the wrong place. Help him get out of a mysterious and gloomy environment full of dangers and mysteries. Solve puzzles, go through difficult situations and make decisions that can determine not only your survival, but also the outcome of the whole story.

LOCATIONS:
The location and the development of the plot depend on a single choice. Each location is unique and has its own characteristics: from the old entrance to the creepy sewer. Explore these places, which are full of secrets and unexpected twists, and be prepared to face frightening creatures and a gloomy atmosphere. Each location can be both a salvation and a source of fear.

SPECIAL ATMOSPHERE:
A key element of the atmosphere of the game is the effect of “liminal” — a borderline state when the familiar boundaries of reality are blurred, and time and space lose their familiar shape. This effect enhances gameplay and creates tension, making you feel uncomfortable and insecure. The adventure is filled with sound effects, creepy soundscapes and surreal images that immerse you in a world of nightmares and uncertainty, where every step can lead to unexpected consequences. Be careful - nothing in this world is what it seems.

OSPIL:
HOSPITAL (Organization for searching for people of international level) is a company founded in 1968 in Sweden by the great Eric Bergquist. The company specialized in searching for missing people when the hope of finding them was disappearing more and more. True professionals in their field.

Val-d'Orsky. Incident:
Date: 1.02.1985:
On January 23, 1985, a group of four people who went on a picnic disappeared in the mountains near Val d'Or, nine days of searches by all the special services of Canada were unsuccessful, so on February 1, 1985, the best missing persons search group arrived in the city, from the best of the best organizations in the world - OSPIL.
And on the first of February 1985, the group began its work.
